item.title: Wizards of the Coast Addresses AI Concerns
item.description:
Highlights

  • Wizards of the Coast bans generative AI in Magic: The Gathering marketing after backlash.
  • The FAQ outlines rules for artists, writers, and creatives involved with D&D and Magic.
  • Policy allows AI use for concept work, storyboarding, but not final products like cards.

Wizards of the Coast , publishers of Dungeons and Dragons and Magic: The Gathering , has released a new FAQ addressing the use of generative AI in both franchises. As a controversial technology, it is an area that fans have been inquiring about. Generative AI has already been at the heart of controversy for Wizards, like when the company replaced AI-generated artwork in Bigby Presents: Glory of Giants for future printings after it was discovered AI artwork had been used.

In January, Wizards of the Coast ran into more trouble when it was found that Magic: The Gathering marketing material was using AI art. This happened after Wizards expressly said that there would be no generative AI used on Magic: The Gathering cards, and it prompted the company to revise how it handles marketing materials going forward. Dungeons and Dragons has also had major issues with AI, such as the example mentioned earlier.

Related
Wizards of the Coast Admits to Using AI Art
Wizards of the Coast responds to yet another AI art controversy, admitting the controversial technology was unknowingly used in some of its marketing.

Wizards of the Coast published an FAQ on generative AI use within the company and its products to address these concerns. This FAQ is the official stance of Wizards regarding generative AI, and its rules regarding the field. It states: "We require artists, writers, and creatives contributing to the Magic TCG and the D&D TTRPG to refrain from using AI generative tools to create final Magic or D&D products." Wizards has also banned generative AI in Magic: The Gathering marketing material after the aforementioned incident in January.

What Is and Isn't Included in Wizards of the Coast's AI Policies

The FAQ also explains how Wizards investigates whether generative AI is used in a product. While being quite vague, it mentions how it is a mixture of having a human re-reviewing art, using tools, and discussing the situation with the artist or creator in question. As Wizards of the Coast saw, false accusations of generative AI use can quickly spread, like what happened with the accusations that some of the One Dungeons and Dragons books releasing later this year were using generative AI.

Wizards also explains that the company will not be commenting on each case, as one of the primary concerns is the privacy of individuals working with the company, even if Wizards decides to no longer work with the artist going forward. Wizards further elaborates that while Hasbro may use generative AI in other products, like Trivial Pursuit , that does not mean Wizards will.

The policy elucidated by the company does have a couple of glaring holes, though. The first is the use of the phrase "final," which means that if it is used for things like storyboarding, concepts, or other work that doesn't make it to print, Wizards is perfectly fine with using generative AI. If an artist working on a Fallout Magic: The Gathering art piece used generative AI to create a depiction of a Deathclaw as it might appear on a card for reference, that is okay per this policy. The other giant loophole is the specificity of the policy, applying only to the core games of both, and thus wouldn't cover things like video games or movies.

item.title: Pokemon Sleep Entei Research Event Dates and Details Revealed
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Sleep's Entei Research Event starts on May 20, giving players a chance to collect Entei Mane samples and encounter the rare Gen 2 Legendary.
  • Fire-type Pokemon will have unique bonuses during the event, increasing ingredient drops and main skill triggers to help players succeed.
  • Entei Biscuits will turn into Great Biscuits after the event ends, but players must exchange their Entei Mane samples before June 6 at 3:59 am.

Pokemon Sleep has officially unveiled the upcoming Entei Research Event, with the occasion kicking off on May 20. This limited Pokemon Sleep event will give players a chance to encounter the rare Gen 2 Legendary and add them to their sleepy team of Pokemon.

Pokemon Sleep 's purpose is to help players improve their sleep quality and ensure that they get regular, healthy sleep. To encourage this, players meet a Snorlax who is drawing in Pokemon from the surrounding area who doze in its presence. Pokemon fans can feed the Snorlax to encounter rarer Pokemon, and those that they befriend can join the player's team to help feed Snorlax special recipes and repeat the process. There are quite a number of Pokemon already available in Pokemon Sleep , but special events add unique Pokemon or increase the rate of discovering those already in the title.

Related
Pokemon Sleep Themed Hotel Room Opens in Famous Hotel Chain
Pokemon Sleep gets its own themed hotel room at a famous hotel chain to celebrate the sleep-tracking app's first anniversary.

Pokemon Sleep 's Entei Research Event will run from May 20 at 4 am through June 3 at 3:59 am. Players will be tasked with collecting Entei Mane samples, which can be traded in for Entei Incense, Entei Biscuits, and some valuable items like Main Skill Seeds and Fire evolutionary Stones . Entei will only appear on Greengrass Isle during this event, and will continue appearing after the event ends, but as a rare encounter.

How to Make the Most of the Pokemon Sleep Entei Research Event

Players should plan on prepping their best Fire-type Pokemon for the event, as they will receive unique bonuses. During the entire event, Fire-types will bring players an extra ingredient, and their main skill will have a 1.5x chance of triggering. Snorlax will also enjoy fire-type Leppa Berries , so players should choose Pokemon who have a chance of finding that berry. During the first week of the event, Fire-type Pokemon will have their Main Skill boosted by 1 level, and during the second week that will rise to 3 levels. Fire-types will also increase the drop rate of Entei Mane samples, which can be collected during a player's first sleep recording of the night.

Players who don't have a good team of Fire-types will also have an opportunity to change that. Charmander, Charmeleon, Charizard, Vulpix, Ninetales, Growlithe, Flareon, Cyndaquil, Quilava, and Typhlosion will have an increased chance of appearing after sleeping for the night.

Once the Entei Research event ends, Entei Biscuits will be converted to Great Biscuits and Entei Incense will be retained and can be used whenever a player likes, but Entei Mane samples will be lost if not exchanged in time. Players will be able to turn in Entei Mane samples until June 6 at 3:59 am.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Mega Evolution for Talonflame
item.description:
Highlights

  • Mega Talonflame fan art imagines the fiery bird with enhanced power through flames and new color pallets, sparking excitement.
  • The return of Mega Evolutions in Pokemon Legends: Z-A has fans speculating on which Pokemon will receive the Mega treatment next.
  • Fans showcase talent and passion for Pokemon with creative fan art, eagerly anticipating potential new Mega Forms in upcoming games.

A talented Pokemon fan has shared what a Mega Evolved Talonflame could look like if it were to be introduced. Mega Evolutions were first introduced to gamers when Pokemon X and Y were released on the 3DS in 2013. The feature was short-lived as the mechanic was dropped from the mainline series when the Pokemon franchise moved to the Nintendo Switch.

The news that Mega Evolutions would return in Pokemon Legends: Z-A excited players as the battle mechanic remains one of the most popular features in the franchise. As it stands, there are 48 different Mega Evolutions available in the Pokemon franchise, and the announcement sparked debate within the community, leading players to speculate on which monsters could be next to get the Mega treatment.

Related
Pokemon Fan Art Gives Houndour and Houndoom New Types
A Pokemon fan artist celebrates a special milestone and redesigns the Pokemon Houndour and Houndoom with different types and names to match.

A Reddit user going by the handle of Macksi_ has created what they think a Mega Talonflame could look like, should the bird be given an opportunity to Mega Evolve. The Fire/Flying-type Pokemon would retain its dual typing, but the design shows flames between each wing and the main body, giving a more powerful look to the creature. Macksi_ has also included two additional color pallets for the Mega Evolved Pokemon, one that is a deeper red to Talonflameâ€™s normal appearance, and one that adapts the striking blue and black color scheme of Mega Charizard X.

A Pokemon Fan Creates Mega Talonflame

When Game Freak announced that Mega Evolutions was returning to the main franchise, there was no shortage of Pokemon fan art depicting Mega Evolved monsters . For example, another dedicated fan has produced artwork depicting Mega Forms of Pokemon, such as Zoroark, Victini, and Seviper. The art was praised for being well-planned and a natural progression for each monster.

As fans wait for the release of the next main entry in the Pokemon franchise, players can still have fun collecting Mega Evolutions in Pokemon GO . Niantic has been slowly adding the Mega forms of Pokemon into the augmented reality mobile game, with Mega Heracross being the latest addition to Pokemon GO .

The fan art Macksi_ has posted showcases the talent and passion fans continue to have with the Pokemon franchise. Although there hasnâ€™t been any official confirmation from Game Freak, Pokemon fans are eager to discover which monsters, if any, will receive a new Mega form in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . It seems that until the game is in the hands of players, the speculation about which Pokemon will get a Mega Evolution will continue.

item.title: Rumor: Helldivers 2 Leak Hints at Destruction of One Planet
item.description:
This article contains potential spoilers for Helldivers 2's story.

Highlights

  • A Helldivers 2 leak hints at players destroying the bug-infested planet Meridia with a mysterious "Dark Fluid" device.
  • Unique bug-filled planets with Terminid enemies pose challenges, requiring farming of Requisition Slips for upgrades.
  • Major Orders task players with liberating bug-controlled planets and offer valuable rewards like Medals and Requisition Slips.

A Helldivers 2 leak suggests players will eventually destroy the planet of Meridia with a mysterious device that uses "Dark Fluid.'' Helldivers 2 's Meridia has turned into a super colony, meaning the entire planet is now occupied by Terminid creatures. After the breakdown of the Terminid Control System, it has been transformed into a barren world.

Helldivers 2 features various bug-infested planets where players must take on waves of creatures to finish objectives and farm Requisition Slips. These planets have their own unique environmental conditions that could make missions harder to complete. They host a variety of Terminid enemies, such as Bile Titans, Chargers, Hunters, and Stalkers that have reportedly gained a new mutation with the latest update.

Related
Helldivers 2 Director Responds to Review Bombing
Helldivers 2 director Johan Pilestedt responds to the recent review bombing the game has received as a result of controversial updates.

A new Helldivers 2 leak from IronS1ghts , who previously leaked vehicles and weapons, hints at the destruction of Meridia, suggesting players will blow up the bug-infested planet with a device that contains a "Dark Fluid." This mysterious device will reportedly be a core part of an objective, which will arrive with the next Major Order. Despite the fact that it will destroy the once-verdant planet, players will activate it to liberate Meridia from Terminid enemies. Not to mention, fans should take this leak with a grain of salt until it's confirmed.

Helldivers 2 Players Speculate About Upcoming Major Order

Fellow players on Reddit shared their interesting theories about Meridia, with one speculating that the upcoming Major Order will require them to fight Helldivers 2 's Hive Lords on this bug-controlled planet. Some also indicated that other planets may change environmentally in the future. It's safe to assume that the next Major Order will give details about what has happened to Meridia.

Having celebrated the eradication of Automaton enemies, Helldivers 2 announced a new Major Order , which tasks players with liberating bug-controlled planets. This community-wide event offers a number of Medals, which are used to unlock weapons and cosmetics in Warbonds permanently. One thing to note is that the current Major Order will be replaced on May 3.

Major Orders in Helldivers 2 serve as community challenges , which force players to complete tasks within a certain time frame to earn rewards. They are the phases of the ongoing Galactic War, whose purpose is to liberate planets from Automaton and Terminid enemies. They provide players with Medals, which are valuable materials that can be used to purchase guns and upgrade loadouts. Moreover, some Major Orders offer Requisition Slips, which are required to buy Stratagems and Ship Modules.

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Adds Classic But Infamous Weapon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players can get the JAK Wardens in MW3, an almost exact replica of MW2's infamous akimbo Model 1887 shotgun.
  • To unlock the JAK Wardens in MW3, complete 5 challenges from Week 5 and apply the kit to the Lockwood Mk2 marksman rifle.
  • A recent bug with the JAK Wardens has been fixed with a hotfix, ensuring smooth gameplay for Call of Duty fans.

Those who remember the mayhem of Modern Warfare 2 's (2009) akimbo attachment for the Model 1887 shotgun can now relive that experience, thanks to Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 's recently added JAK Wardens conversion kit. The new Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 kit turns the Lockwood Mk2 marksman rifle into a spitting image of the infamous weapon.

Fans can thank MW3 's Season 3 Reloaded update for the JAK Wardens. The major patch introduced plenty of other content to Sledgehammer's first-person shooter, including two new modes and two 6v6 maps. With about five months still to go in MW3 's lifespan, the game is on track to be the most heavily supported title in terms of post-launch content during Call of Duty 's Warzone era. MW3 's post-launch support has also benefited from the new conversion kit feature, which lets Sledgehammer release new versions of already added weapons.

2:12
Related
Why June 9 Will Be a Big Day for Call of Duty Fans
Any fans of the Call of Duty franchise, especially Black Ops, will make sure that they circle Sunday, June 9 on their calendars.

MW3 's newest conversion kit, the JAK Wardens, can be unlocked by completing five weekly challenges from the Week 5 page. After doing so, the JAK Wardens kit can be applied to the Lockwood Mk2. This transforms the marksman rifle into an almost exact replica of the akimbo Model 1887s, complete with the same firing animation that sees the weapons flipped around with each shot. While the JAK Wardens are a strong choice for shotgun fans, the kit doesn't come close to the 1887s' broken nature in the original MW2 , fortunately. Those who played that game during its first few months will likely remember the akimbo shotguns that could eliminate enemies from almost halfway across a map in one salvo. Thankfully, Call of Duty 's development teams often address issues in a matter of days or weeks now, instead of months.

How To Unlock The JAK Wardens Conversion Kit In Modern Warfare 3

  • Complete any five challenges from the Week 5 challenge page
  • Navigate to the Lockwood Mk2's gunsmith screen and select the JAK Wardens conversion kit

After the JAK Wardens' recent release, users noticed a bug that caused its bullets to travel incorrectly when both shotguns were fired at the same time. Call of Duty developers have promptly fixed the issue by releasing a hotfix earlier today on May 3. Alongside the hotfix was a note explaining that a frustrating new Warzone bug is being worked on as well. Sometime next week, fans can expect an additional bug fix for that issue, which causes Automatic Tactical Sprint users in Warzone to have their reloads continuously canceled.

Although the JAK Wardens are fun to use, they haven't proved as powerful as an earlier Call of Duty conversion kit that turned the Haymaker shotgun into a 60-round menace. Fortunately, since its initial release, the Haymaker kit has been repeatedly nerfed to bring it back to Earth.

In terms of other new content, MW3 also just released its Devin Booker bundle as its latest collaboration with an NBA star. The bundle is available now for 2,400 CoD Points, but NBA fans looking to complete their Call of Duty skin collection will have to wait for Kevin Durant's bundle to return to CoD 's in-game store.
